page.title: 06The Shore-Hest Bank.
page.content: The shore at Hest Bank is split up into two parts.There is sand far out so when the tide comes in it is all covered.Then near the shore there are gullies and grassy banks.The tide covers the gullies but the grassy banks are above high tide level.There is a channel that is very wide and it flows towards the sea.It is called Hatlex Beck.The tides around Hest Bank are very dangerous.When the tide is out you can go across Morecambe Bay with a guide,but there is sinking sand and the tide comes in very quickly round you so you can get trapped.The birds around Morecambe Bay come from many countries in the north to feed on the sea life left behind when the tide goes out.These birds include Redshank,Gulls and many waders.
